meanings.definition: Divide into two parts or classifications.
meanings.sent1: I will dichotomize the tasks into urgent and non-urgent.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dichotomize her wardrobe into work clothes and casual wear.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to dichotomize the menu into sweet and savory dishes.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to dichotomize the problem into black and white solutions.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes dichotomize the canvas into light and shadow.

meanings.definition: To create a division or contrast between two things.
meanings.sent1: The movie will dichotomize the characters into heroes and villains.
meanings.sent2: The debate aims to dichotomize the opinions on the issue.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to dichotomize reality and illusion.
meanings.sent4: The song lyrics dichotomize love and heartbreak in a beautiful way.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting dichotomize warmth and coolness.
